item.title: By: steven v
item.dc:creator: steven v
item.description:
Hope springs eternal in the human breast; Man never Is, but always To be blest: The soul, uneasy and confin'd from home, Rests and expatiates in a life to come.
-Alexander Pope, An Essay on Man, Epistle I, 1733
item.content:encoded:
Hope springs eternal in the human breast;
Man never Is, but always To be blest:
The soul, uneasy and confin’d from home,
Rests and expatiates in a life to come.

-Alexander Pope,
An Essay on Man, Epistle I, 1733

item.title: By: Dimble

item.description: Don't forget about Samwise the Brave!

item.title: By: shagcarpet
item.dc:creator: shagcarpet
item.description:
Mmmm, intrigue, betrayal, suspense, lust, vengeance and phat lewtz... a virtual goldmine of literary goodness.
You sir, are the Vincent Price of the new millenium.
item.content:encoded:
Mmmm, intrigue, betrayal, suspense, lust, vengeance and phat lewtz… a virtual goldmine of literary goodness.

You sir, are the Vincent Price of the new millenium.

item.title: By: Kareem
item.dc:creator: Kareem
item.description:
Hey there was a sad smiley there!
Looking forward to Monday too now, but multi-part... the suspense will consume us.
item.content:encoded:
Hey there was a sad smiley there!

Looking forward to Monday too now, but multi-part… the suspense will consume us.

item.title: By: Raziel
item.dc:creator: Raziel
item.description:
Although one wonders if "Love and War ... craft" would have been as highly acclaimed if it was published under its original name "War(craft) -- What Is It Good For?"
Looking forward to Monday! (can't believe I said that)
item.content:encoded:
Although one wonders if “Love and War … craft” would have been as highly acclaimed if it was published under its original name “War(craft) — What Is It Good For?”

Looking forward to Monday! (can’t believe I said that)
